chapter.pericope: A Lament for Pharaoh, King of Egypt
chapter.p: 1And thenLiterally “and it was/happened” in the twelfthLiterally “two of ten” year, in the twelfthLiterally “in two ten month” month, on the first day of the month, the word of Yahweh cameLiterally “was” to me, saying,Literally “to say” 2“Son of man,Or “mortal,” or “son of humankind” raise a lament over Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, and you must say to him,

ul.li1: ‘With a fierce, strong lion among nations you compared yourself,
ul.li2: and you are like the sea monster in the seas,
and you thrash about in your rivers,
and you make water turbid with your feet,
and you make your rivers muddy.

ul.li1: Now I will spread my net over you
ul.li2: in the assembly of many peoples,
and I will bring you up in my dragnet.
ul.li1: 4And I will throw you on the ground;
ul.li2: on the surface of the open field I will hurl you,
ul.li1: and I will cause every bird of the heaven to dwell on you,
ul.li2: and I will satisfy the animalsHebrew “animal” of all of the world from you.
ul.li1: 5And I will put your flesh on the mountains,
ul.li2: and I will fill the valleys with your carcass.
ul.li1: 6And I will water the land with your discharge from your blood
ul.li2: on the mountains,
and valleys will be filled fromOr “with” you.
ul.li1: 7And I will cover you atOr “by” extinguishing your heavens,
ul.li2: and I will make dark their stars,
ul.li1: and I will cover the sun with the cloud,
ul.li2: and the moon will not give its light.
ul.li1: 8AllOr “every” sources of light in the heavens,
ul.li2: I will make them dark over you,
and I will putOr “give” darkness on your land,’ ”

ul.li1: 9“And I will disturb the heartsHebrew “heart” of many peoples
ul.li2: at my bringing about your captivity among the nations,
to countries that you do not know.
ul.li1: 10And I will cause many peoples to be awestruck over you,
ul.li2: and their kings will shudder over you in horror,
ul.li1: atOr “when” my brandishing my sword before their faces,
ul.li2: and they will tremble continually,Literally “for moments/seconds”
ul.li1: each person for his life,
ul.li2: on the day of your downfall.”

ul.li1: “The sword of the king of Babylon,
ul.li2: it will come to you.
ul.li1: 12By the swords of warriors I will cause to fall your hordes
ul.li2: by the most ruthless of the nations, all of them,
ul.li1: and they will devastate the majesty of Egypt,
ul.li2: and all of its hordes will be destroyed.
ul.li1: 13And I will destroy all her domestic livestock
ul.li2: besideLiterally “from on” many waters.
ul.li1: The feet of humansHebrew “human” will not make them turbid again,
ul.li2: and the hooves of domestic livestock will not make them turbid.
ul.li1: 14Then I will make their waters settle,
ul.li2: and their rivers as the olive oil I will let flow,”

ul.li1: 15“Then I make the land of Egypt a desolation,
ul.li2: so that the land will be stripped from its fullness
ul.li1: when I strike all of those dwelling in it,
ul.li2: and they will know that I am Yahweh.

chapter.p: 16This isLiterally “she is” a lament, and they will chant it as a lament; the daughters of the nations will chant it as a lament over Egypt, and over all of its hordes they will chant it as a lament,” declaresLiterally “declaration of” the Lord Yahweh.

17And thenLiterally “and it happened/was” in the twelfthLiterally “two of ten” year, on the fifteenthLiterally “in the five ten of” day of the month, the word of Yahweh cameLiterally “was” to me, saying,Literally “to say” 18“Son of man,Or “mortal,” or “son of humankind” mourn over the hordes of Egypt, and make her go down, and with her the daughters of mighty nations, down to the deep underworldLiterally “to the world/earth deeps/depth” with the people going down to the grave.Or “pit” or “netherworld” 19You are more lovely than whom?Literally “from whom are you lovely” Go down and be laid in rest with the uncircumcised. 20In the midst of the people slain by the sword itOr “she”; that is, Egypt is given they will fall to a sword; they carried herOr “it” off and all of herOr “its” hordes. 21The chiefs of the warriors will speak to him from the middle of Sheol; with his helpers they have gone down; the uncircumcised lie still, those slain by the sword.Literally “the slain of the sword”

22Assyria is there and all of its assembly; all around it are its graves, all of them killed, those fallen by the sword, 23whoThat is, Assyria will be given its graves in the remote areas of the pit, and its assembly will be all around its grave, all of them killed, fallen by the sword, those who spread terror in the land of the living.

24Elam is there and all of its hordes, all around its grave, all of them dead who fell by the sword, those who went down uncircumcised to the depths of the underworld,Literally “land/earth/world” those who spread their terror to the land of the living, and now they bear their disgrace with the people going down to the grave.Or “pit” or “sheol” 25In the midst of the slain they made a bed for her with all of her hordes all around its graves, all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword, for their terror was spread in the land of the living, and they now bear their disgrace with the people going down to the grave;Or “pit” in the midst of the slain it was placed.

26Meshech and Tubal are there and all of its hordes, all around him its graves, all of them uncircumcised and killed by the sword, for they gave their terror in the land of the living. 27And they do not lie with warriors fallen from long ago, who went down to Sheol with their weapons of war,Literally “with the weapons of war their” and they placed their sword under their heads, and their shieldsReading “their shields” for “their guilt” were on their bones, for the terror of the warriors was in the land of the living. 28And youEvidently refers to Egypt too in the midst of uncircumcised people will be broken, and you will lie with those slain by the sword.

29There is Edom, its kings and all of its leaders who are laid along with their might with those killed by the sword; they will lie with the uncircumcised and with the people going down to the grave.Or “pit”

30There are also the princes of the north, all of them, all of the Sidonians who have gone down, being ashamed to lie with the slain becauseOr “in spite of” (cf. NJPS, NIV) of their terror that they caused from their might, and they lie uncircumcised with those killed by the sword, and they bear their disgrace along with the people going down to the grave.Or “pit”

31Pharaoh will see them, and he will be comforted over all of his hordes killed by the sword, Pharaoh and all of his army,” declaresLiterally “declaration of” the Lord Yahweh. 32“ForOr “although” he spreadHebrew “I gave” my terror in the land of the living, and so he will be laid down in the midst of the uncircumcised with those killed by the sword: Pharaoh and all of his hordes,”declaresLiterally “declaration of” the Lord Yahweh.
